poem:
A Meeting of Contrasts

In Berlin's crisp light,
Scholz and Milei collide,
brief as a bird's flight,
whispers mix with cries.

Beyond iron gates,
chants of despots breathe,
placards pen their fates,
liberty's harsh wreath.

Limousines depart,
like shadows at dawn,
a nation counts heart,
intention not withdrawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Olaf Scholz welcomes Argentina’s president Javier Milei to Germany The German chancellor, Olaf Scholz, has welcomed Argentina’s populist president, Javier Milei, for a controversial and unusually short meeting in Berlin after the divisive leader accepted an award from a German foundation with links to the far right. Protesters, some holding placards reading “No trade with despots”, jeered from beyond the gates of Scholz’s chancellery as the self-described anarcho-capitalist emerged from his limousine on his first". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Olaf Scholz welcomes Argentina’s president Javier Milei to Germany The German chancellor, Olaf Scholz, has welcomed Argentina’s populist president, Javier Milei, for a controversial and unusually short meeting in Berlin after the divisive leader accepted an award from a German foundation with links to the far right.
